pr_title: [PARQUET-1808]: Replacing multiple String Object creations with StringBuilder

timeline.message: [PARQUET-1808]: Replacing multiple String Object creations with StringBuilder

timeline.author: gszadovszky

timeline.bodyText: As we are doing this change because of performance reasons I would create a private method in SimpleGroup that gets the StringBuilder object is it can append all the stuff into the same builder.
timeline.author: gszadovszky

replies.bodyText: Isn't it already using same StringBuilder?
replies.author: koiralo

replies.bodyText:
This method is recursive in case of the child is a Group. This method appends the string generated by this recursive invocation. So, if you have a deeply nested structure it would create a bunch of StringBuilder objects, generate String objects from them and appends them to the StringBuilder object created at the higher level.
Instead, I would suggest passing the StringBuilder object created at the top level to the children's methods so you'll have only one builder and everything will be appended to it directly.
replies.author: gszadovszky

replies.bodyText: Thanks for detail explanation, I didn't take a detail look in recursive. I think changing a method signature and using StringBuilder should be enough.
replies.author: koiralo

timeline.bodyText:
You may create the builder with an exact capacity so it does not need to grow during appending values.
Also, you may count in the message itself and appending it instead of concatenating the indent to the message separately.
timeline.author: gszadovszky

timeline.bodyText:
nit: you may keep the chain pattern as append returns the builder object.
Do not have a strong opinion on the current or the chained version.
timeline.author: gszadovszky
gszadovszky

replies.bodyText: Ok make sense. have done the required changes.
replies.author: koiralo

timeline.author: gszadovszky
